bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: Explain Francis' feelings of nostalgia for the early years of his ministry.
questions.correctAnswer: In the early years, the brothers were young and being few in number, they created a community focused on poverty and prayer
distractors: He missed the simplicity before the Pope's approval
He regretted not staying in Assisi with his family
He wished he had become a priest earlier
He longed for the days before his imprisonment
He mourned the loss of Brother Bernard

questions.question: Why did Francis decide to hand over the leadership of the Franciscan Order to someone else?
questions.correctAnswer: Francis was more charismatic than administrative, so he stepped down and turned leadership over to Brother Peter and then Brother Elias
distractors: Because the Pope commanded him to step down
Because he wanted to focus on prayer and solitude
Because he became too ill to lead
Because the brothers voted him out
Because he wanted to go on pilgrimage

questions.question: What were some of the reasons Francis felt like his health was beginning to fail?
questions.correctAnswer: He began to think that over his lifetime he had been too harsh on his body
distractors: He had contracted leprosy from the lepers
He was wounded in the crusades
He had a chronic illness from childhood
He was poisoned by enemies
He suffered from old battle wounds

questions.question: In what ways was Francis' health beginning to fail?
acceptableAnswers: He was in pain and couldn't walk the whole way when he traveled
distractors: He had a persistent cough and fever
He could no longer speak clearly
His hands were crippled with arthritis
He suffered from constant headaches
He had stomach problems and couldn't eat

questions.question: What had Francis been na√Øve about that made him feel like his life was a failure?
questions.correctAnswer: He believed that others would see the beauty of the gospel through his example and begin living simply and serving others
distractors: He thought the Pope would support radical poverty
He expected all Christians to become friars
He believed the Crusades would end peacefully
He thought the Sultan would convert
He expected his father to reconcile with him

questions.question: When Francis looked back on his life and felt discouraged, what form of prayer did he return to for comfort?
questions.correctAnswer: He returned to his reflection on the cross
distractors: He prayed the Our Father repeatedly
He meditated on Scripture passages
He sang the Canticle of the Creatures
He prayed to Mary for intercession
He recited the prayers of the Mass

questions.question: What was the paradox about Jesus on the cross that Francis had to come to understand?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus suffered out of love for the salvation of humanity
distractors: Jesus was both fully God and fully man
Jesus died but also conquered death
Jesus was weak but also all-powerful
Jesus was abandoned yet never alone
Jesus was innocent yet punished for sin

acceptableAnswers: They were signs of God's glory
He had learned how to internalize the cross by embracing sufferings and weaknesses
distractors: They were punishments for his sins
They were tests of his faithfulness
They were the devil's attacks
They were necessary for salvation
They were temporary and would pass

questions.question: What animal helped Francis continue his journey up the steep mountainside to Laverna?
distractors: A horse
A mule
An ox
The brothers carried him
He walked with a staff

questions.question: How long did Francis stay isolated where he would pray and fast during his last mountain retreat in Laverna?
distractors: 7 days
21 days
30 days
50 days
100 days

questions.question: What virtues had Francis developed in his lifetime as he kept his mind fixed on God?
questions.correctAnswer: He perfected charity by practicing virtues, serving others, and loving God habitually
distractors: He mastered patience through suffering
He achieved perfect obedience to authority
He gained complete humility and self-denial
He developed unwavering faith in trials
He attained wisdom through contemplation

questions.question: What was Francis' prayer on the Feast of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross?
questions.correctAnswer: To feel in his body the pain that Jesus felt on the cross and to know in his heart the love that Jesus had for all humanity
distractors: To understand the mystery of the Trinity
To see a vision of heaven
To heal the sick and perform miracles
To convert all people to Christianity
To rebuild the Church completely

questions.question: What appeared before Francis as he made this prayer?
questions.correctAnswer: A fiery and brilliant six-winged angel
distractors: Jesus on the cross bleeding
Mary holding the infant Jesus
A bright light from heaven
The apostles in white robes
A dove descending from the sky

questions.question: How was Francis' prayer answered?
questions.correctAnswer: He received the stigmata, the wounds of Christ and felt terrible pain which stayed with him the rest of his life
distractors: He had a vision of Christ's passion
He heard God's voice speaking to him
He felt overwhelming love and joy
He was healed of all his illnesses
He experienced perfect peace

questions.question: Name two feasts in the Christian liturgical year that mark the life, love and mission of Christ that were also central in Francis' life.
distractors: Pentecost and Epiphany
Ascension and Transfiguration
Good Friday and Palm Sunday
Annunciation and Assumption
Corpus Christi and Sacred Heart

questions.question: How were these two feasts reflected in Francis' life?
questions.correctAnswer: The reenactment of the nativity scene at Greccio and the reception of the stigmata at Laverna
distractors: His conversion in Spoleto and his meeting with the Sultan
His imprisonment in Perugia and his freedom in Christ
His kiss of the leper and his blessing of creatures
His rebuilding of San Damiano and founding the order
His pilgrimage to Rome and journey to the Holy Land

questions.question: How did Francis live the Via Purgativa (the Purgative Way)?
questions.correctAnswer: Worked to convert his will to the will of God through penance
distractors: Studied theology to purify his mind
Fasted constantly to purify his body
Confessed his sins daily
Avoided all worldly pleasures
Punished himself for past mistakes

questions.question: How did Francis live the Via Illuminativa (the Illuminative Way)?
questions.correctAnswer: Learned more and more about God and found ways to grow closer to God
distractors: Received visions and revelations regularly
Taught others about the faith
Read Scripture for hours each day
Experienced mystical enlightenment
Performed miracles to show God's power

questions.question: How did Francis live the Via Unitiva (the Unitive Way)?
questions.correctAnswer: Fully united with God spiritually and physically with the stigmata
distractors: Achieved perfect contemplation in prayer
Became one with creation
United all Christians in the order
Joined his suffering with Christ's passion
Reached the highest level of holiness

questions.question: How did Francis feel as he left Laverna and returned to Assisi?
questions.correctAnswer: He had renewed peace and an all-encompassing love for all people and the world
distractors: He felt exhausted and near death
He was filled with joy about his wounds
He was afraid of what others would think
He felt sad to leave the mountain
He was eager to share his experience
